intro: Poikilogyne bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored flax, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Linaceae and is characterized by its striking bi-colored flowers, typically featuring a white base and a purple or pink upper part. The plant grows up to 1 meter in height, with slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in clusters and are pollinated primarily by insects. Poikilogyne bicolor is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has historical uses in traditional medicine.
